CatDescriptText: Robert Cook, 16 Hallet Street, Fifth Ward and Leroy Perkins, television and refrigerator repairman, 2159 Centre Avenue, Fifth Ward, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 31, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Who is your ward chairman? Does he have any power?  Does he exert it?" Robert Cook's answer reads: "I don't know who the ward chairman is, whether he has power and whether or not he exerts it.  I'm just interested in voting each election day."  Leroy Perkins' answer reads: "I don't know who the ward boss is.  The main reason, I guess, is that I'm not interested in politics.  All i do is vote."
TitMainTitle: Leroy Perkins, and Robert Cook wearing Asian landscape patterned shirt, standing on sidewalk outside of Lucky Cafe Chop Suey, Centre Avenue, HIll District
